title: Example - Reproducible Fmask processing
description:
Background

The tools of the Storm ecosystem are designed to meet many different types of needs. Using these tools, researchers can process their data in a reproducible way. Also, functionalities are provided that allow researchers to develop research and collaboratively compose their results.

In this context, this example has been created to present how users can use the tools of the Storm ecosystem. It shows how tools that are not directly processing scripts (e.g., command line tools) can be reproducible with the Storm ecosystem tools.

Application

This example presents the use of the Python FMask tool for cloud detection in a Sentinel-2/MSI scene. The Saracá-Taquera National Forest region, located northwest of the Pará state in Brazil, was chosen as the study area.
